| HistoryText             = The Masters of Evil were a group of villains spawned through the time-space rift in the Gamma core on [[Avengers Island]]. Their membres included [[Nathan Garrett (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|The Black Knight]], [[Chen Lu (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Radioactive Man]], [[David Cannon (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Whirlwind]], [[Bruno Horgan (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Melter]] and [[Ulysses Klaw (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Klaw]].{{Citation}}

They would attack [[Avengers Mansion]] following the groups battle with [[Amora (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|the Enchantress']] [[Lethal Legion (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Lethal Legion]]. The Masters were easily defeated by the Avengers and while [[Steve Rogers (Earth-616)|Captain America]] and [[Anthony Stark (Earth-616)|Iron Man]] were called off on other business, they were left in the care of [[Clinton Barton (Earth-616)|Hawkeye]] and [[Patricia Walker (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Hellcat]]. They would be visited by [[Loki Laufeyson (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Loki]] who was then absorbing beings that were unique to [[Counter-Earth (Heroes Reborn)|Counter-Earth]] to boost his power. He would absorb the Masters of Evil, and coerce Hawkeye and Hellcat to join his cause. Ultimately, Loki would be defeated and all those he absorbed were expelled from Loki.{{Citation}}

The Masters of Evil would regroup, however Klaw would not rejoin the team and his fate remains unrevealed. Being absorbed by Loki had a profound effect on at least two members of the Masters of Evil: Radioactive Man would grow silent and eventually not speak at all, and the Melter would enter a near catatonic state muttering about his glimpses of the future.{{Citation}}

As time went on, the [[Avengers (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Avengers]] and other heroes were returned to their native reality of [[Earth-616]], and the Counter-Earth pocket dimension would be manipulated by [[Tiamut (Earth-616)|The Dreaming Celestial]] throwing the Earth into social, political, and ecological chaos. The Black Knight, listening to the Melter's visions would encourage the Black Knight to attempt to become a major player in the power struggle to control the Earth.{{Citation}}

To this end, he made a deal with [[Atlantean]] [[Krang (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Warlord Krang]] to obtain the Trumpet Horn of Atlantis. Krang would give it to the Black Knight to summon [[Giganto (Atlantean Beast)|Giganto]] the whale. What the Black Knight was unaware of the fact that Giganto was killed in a battle against the [[Fantastic Four (Earth-616)|Fantastic Four]] a year earlier, and that Krang hoped that the Black Knight would use the horn which would summon man sea creatures and further flood the United States. Unaware of this betrayal, the Black Knight would betray Krang himself, dispatching Whirlwind and Radioactive Man to slay Krang and his minions. This would be accomplished by irradiating Lake Michigan, literally microwaving the Atlanteans. However, Chen Lu would over do it, killing all the fish in the lake.{{Citation}}

Seeking an alliance with [[Victor von Doom (Earth-616)|Dr. Doom]] who was then attempting to take over Counter-Earth, the Black Knight would attempt to seek an audience with the [[Latverian]] monarch. To this end, the Masters would recruit both [[Boris Bullski (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|Titanium Man]] and [[Anton Vanko (Heroes Reborn) (Earth-616)|the Crimson Dynamo]]. Becoming aware of the fact that Whirlwind was planning on skipping out on the Masters of Evil, the Black Knight would dispatch Radioactive Man to kill him. {{Citation}}

Caught in the act of fleeing, Whirlwind would convince the Radioactive Man to let him live, and he would flee Chicago seemingly abandoning his costumed activities. The Black Knight would go to the [[Baxter Building]] to meed with Dr. Doom, offering him the Trumpet Horn of Atlantis as a gift. However, this would not be Doom, but rather one of his many [[Doombots]] and it would kill the Black Knight, Titanium Man and Crimson Dynamo as per his masters order. Doom himself not wanting to get involved with two bit tyrants with lowly ambitions of world domination.{{Citation}}

The fate of the Radioactive Man and Melter are unknown.{{Citation}}
